medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening epigastric abdominal pain and nausea/vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with a 12-hour history of worsening epigastric abdominal pain and nausea/vomiting that migrated from the epigastric region to the right lower quadrant (RLQ). The patient has experienced epigastric pain and vomiting approximately every 3 weeks. This current episode is described as different due to its severity, with vomiting not improving the pain. She reported a decreased PO intake. Notably, the pain occurs after alcohol consumption but has also occurred without any alcohol intake.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Frequent urinary tract infections; recent sinus surgery five days prior under general anesthesia due to frequent sinus infections.
